data.title: Lobby tooltips issues

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Crash when hovering over a grey ping indicator

```
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteFont.Measure(String text) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\SpriteFont.cs:line 87
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.ClientTooltipLogic.<>c__DisplayClass9.<.ctor>b__0()
   at OpenRA.Widgets.TooltipContainerWidget.Draw() in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\TooltipContainerWidget.cs:line 46
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter() in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 324
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter() in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 326
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter() in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 326
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.Draw() in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 58
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Viewport.DrawRegions(WorldRenderer wr, IInputHandler inputHandler) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\Viewport.cs:line 129
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 140
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 389
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 91
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 36
```

`Client.IpAddress` being null is probably the cause.

Also it should show the external IP address for the host instead of 127.0.0.1.

data.title: Disallow glitchy overbright player color remaps everywhere

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: The first impression is that this is a bug in the engine because it just looks messed up. See picture and comment at http://www.moddb.com/games/openra/images/fort-lonestar#imagebox

data.title: New/Improved lobby tooltips
data.body:
This implements the C&C spawn tooltips in RA and d2k, and adds a tooltip over the ping block showing the client IP, latency, and whether the client is the admin.

Latency thresholds have been tightened to give a more realistic picture of when to expect poor performance with the default order lag.

data.title: Drop HackyAI now that we have a decent replacement
Added in-game network stats
data.body:
As requested in #2281.

Also wired up the check if clients lag behind the current net frame (labeled as Delay). My plan is to expose the network stats tab to everyone and gameplay stats to allies not just spectators as requested in #2511 once #3135 is merged.

Note this is also useful for #2693 because it exposes the IP to everyone (not just the server and not just hidden in a log file) which can then be traced to identify trolls and get them banned for the next round.

Known limitations: the PlayerPinger server trait from #3158 does not update in-game, so latency and jitter do not show the live values, but the average calculated in the lobby.

data.title: More robust replay file creation
Incorrect "Trait prerequisites not satisfied (or prerequisite loop)"
data.body:
The yaml rule parser is busted and it is not easy to understand the real error:

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Trait prerequisites not satisfied (or prerequisite loop) Actor=world Unresolved=SpawnMPUnitsInfo,SpawnMPUnitsInfo Missing=MPStartLocationsInfo
```

with this rules:

``` yaml
    MPStartLocations:
    SpawnMPUnits@gdi:
        InitialUnit: mcvg
        Faction: gdi
    SpawnMPUnits@nod:
        InitialUnit: mcvn
        Faction: nod
```

Trying to fix #2129 with https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/compare/cnc-techtree-capture

data.title: Show (and allow editing of) actor facings in the editor
data.body: Currently configuring the FacingInit requires yaml hacking, and that's silly for something like setting a unit's facing.

data.title: Rewrite ingame ping implementation.
data.body:
This replaces the ICMP based ping with a more appropriate estimation using ping/pong orders. This also moves the lobby ping & admin indicators off the player name, and reduces a pile of duplication in the player bin lobby wiring.

The dynamic order lag has been removed for now, as doing it properly is not a trivial fix.

data.title: Load screen / Renderer NRE

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
The initialization order of Renderer / ModData / LoadScreen hides a NRE behind a timeout check. If the loading janks at just the right time the load screen will attempt to access the uninitialized Renderer.Fonts and throw an NRE. This is a problem with all 3 LoadScreens.

Initially reported by http://forum.dune2k.com/topic/24184-opend2k-cross-platform-reimplementation-of-dune-2000/page-10#entry380573

and (unintentionally) reproduced by myself in C&C:

```
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.CncLoadScreen.Display () [0x000df] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Cnc//CncLoadScreen.cs:91 
  at OpenRA.ModData..ctor (System.String[] mods) [0x000a5] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//ModData.cs:38 
  at OpenRA.Game.InitializeWithMods (System.String[] mods) [0x0012f] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:314 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00182] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:279 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:89 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0002b] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:36 
```

data.title: Mine laying usability problems
data.body:
Areas to-be mined cannot be selected if there is a context box active, usually from trees.

Mines will not detonate if the unit leaves the cell at a different angle then it entered it.

Picture
1: Mine layer will not accept orders to lay mines as context box for "Trees" is active.
2: The mine would not be set off if the tank were to take the shown path.
https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-Y5oSC7MuTQY/UXYLt-zP1II/AAAAAAAAAeg/aXr6Y4qipFQ/s544/mine%2520errors.jpg

milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body: I also disallowed watching replays of different versions so we don't get spammed with desync crash reports once the automated error reporting from #2854 is added. It also displays more information about the review to assist you in finding what match you are looking for. This was wished for in #2152 and #3002.

data.title: Left click control issues.
data.body:
Issues with using left-click controls in playtest (0421)

1) With units selected, trying to select a single unit without click+drag does not work.

2) With units selected, when you are telling them to move if you click+drag (happens unintentionally very easily) it deselects everything. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4952

3) Units cannot be told to deploy while moving.

data.title: Left click control issues.
data.body:
When using the standard C&C left click controls there are a few issues.

1: With unit(s) selected, you cannot select an individual unit unless you first deselect everything. 
2: With unit(s) selected, if you click to tell them to move then drag the mouse (easily happens unintentionally) it will deselect everything.
3: Units such as the demo truck can't be deployed/detonated while moving.

data.title: Gameserver browser ping polishing

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.title: Hotkey changes
data.body:
- Removed the `ALT` modifier for buildings hotkeys
- Changed some unit and building hotkeys
- Soviet buildings `BuildPaletteOrder:` now matches the Allies buildings BPO
- Changed flamethrower and shock trooper's `BuildPaletteOrder:`

data.title: Refreshing the server list clears ping information
data.body:
If you press refresh, the ping information is reset to unknown, no matter how recent the ping information is (it could be from a few minutes ago to just refreshed, doesn't change the result).

It would be better to keep the ping information instead of removing them. In the long run, it might be even nicer to refresh the pings at the same time, too.

data.title: Interface becomes unresponsive while pinging servers
data.body: When the "ping" button is pressed in the server browser, the interface will freeze for about 5-20 seconds while it pings all the servers. It looks like the game crashes (even the mouse cursor won't move during that time, however you can get it outside the window if you don't have the game in fullscreen). Everything continues fine after the pinging has finished.

data.title: Give the mechanic a wrench cursor icon instead of red-cross
data.body: closes #3133

data.title: Tanks' ROF increased
data.body:
Increased ROF of tanks. The guns of Light & Medium Tanks are a bit weak
relative to their role as tanks. They do less damage than bike rockets,
and do less damage against light vehicles than even the hum-vee. Changing
ROF should mitigate this a bit, even though their gun is still not that
powerful (e.g. compared to stealth tank, and even flame tank matched light
tank). The fact that their rivals are often moving fasts also complicates
the slower ROF.

The same proportion of damage was kept between light & medium tanks.
Mammoth Tank was left unchanged.
